metadata.title: CVE-2023-29547 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
When a secure cookie existed in the Firefox cookie jar an insecure cookiefor the same domain could have been created, when it should have silentlyfailed. This could have led to a desynchronization in expected results whenreading from the secure cookie. This vulnerability affects Firefox forAndroid < 112, Firefox < 112, and Focus for Android < 112.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-29547` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 112.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 112.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 112.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '112.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
